goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time, which can help us optimize flight schedules.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common origin airport, which can help us optimize flight routes and schedules.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of cancelled flights, which can help us identify potential issues with flight operations.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of flight distances and can help us optimize flight routes and schedules.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# Plot histogram of departure_delay
sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(x=data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {data["departure_delay"].median():.2f}')
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# Convert time fields to datetime
data['air_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['air_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with missing values
data = data[pd.notna(data['air_time'])]

# Create scatter plot
sns.scatterplot(x='distance', y='air_time', data=data)

# Add title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?')
plt.xlabel('Distance')
plt.ylabel('Air Time')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
sns.countplot(x='origin_airport', data=data, order=data['origin_airport'].value_counts().index, palette='viridis')
plt.title('What is the most common origin airport?')
plt.xlabel('Origin Airport')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.tight_layout()

# Return plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# Create a pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
cancelled = data['cancelled'].value_counts()
plt.pie(cancelled, labels=['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled'], autopct='%1.1f%%', colors=['#4CAF50', '#F44336'])
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?')

# Show the chart
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# Plot histogram of distance
sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['distance'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean distance: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].mean()))
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?')
plt.xlabel('Distance (miles)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()
```
